entity1.name: ink
entity1.description: A liquid or paste used for writing, drawing, printing, or decoration.

entity2.name: skin

entity4.name: ancient Egypt
entity4.description: A civilization in northeastern Africa that flourished along the Nile River from about 3100 BCE to 30 BCE.

entity5.name: Asia
entity5.description: The largest continent on Earth, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres.

entity6.name: Europe
entity6.description: A continent that comprises the westernmost part of Eurasia, located entirely in the Northern Hemisphere and mostly in the Eastern Hemisphere.

entity7.name: indigenous cultures
entity7.description: Refers to the traditional and native societies that have historical continuity with pre-invasion or pre-colonial societies.

entity8.name: tattoos

entity9.name: Polynesian cultures
entity9.description: A group of indigenous peoples and their associated cultural practices originating from the Polynesian islands in the Pacific Ocean.

entity10.name: tattoos

entity11.name: Japan

entity13.name: Tattoo artists

entity14.name: tribal designs

entity15.name: hyper-realistic portraits
entity15.description: A style of art that aims to create a high level of detail and realism, making the artwork appear as lifelike as possible.

entity16.name: tattooing

entity17.name: artist

entity18.name: client

entity19.name: Communication
entity19.description: The exchange of information or news among people through speaking, writing, or using some other medium.

entity20.name: tattooing process

entity21.name: artist
entity21.description: An individual who creates art, in this context specifically referring to someone skilled in creating tattoos.

entity22.name: client

entity23.name: design
entity23.description: A plan or drawing produced to show the look and function of something before it is made.

entity24.name: placement
